newsitem.title: USA: Korea Telecom files for $200 mln in notes.
newsitem.headline: Korea Telecom files for $200 mln in notes.

text.p: Korea Telcom filed Monday with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission to sell up to $200 million in notes.
The offering will be made through Salomon Brothers Inc, Citicorp Securities Inc and Morgan Stanley & Co Inc.

Proceeds will be used to fund a portion of the acquisition and launch costs of a telecommunications satellite, to fund a portion of the construction costs of additional submarine optical cable networks and to fund a portion of its investment in Vietnam and in Mexico.
Korea Telecom, based in Seoul, is the only licensed supplier of fixed-link, local telephone service in Korea.
